headline: Baked French Fries
description: This baked French fries recipe uses olive oil and seasons the potatoes with paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and chili for a fantastic flavor!

video.description: See the tasty way to make baked French fries.
video.name: Baked French Fries I

name: Baked French Fries

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Cut potato into thick wedges. Mix olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, chili powder, and onion powder together in a medium bowl. Add potato wedges and toss to coat evenly; arrange on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven, turning once or twice, until golden brown and crispy, about 45 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I love these! However I baked them at 400, turning after 10 minutes. Thanks allrecipes! I always come here first
Quick & Easy!
I loved this recipe i just added cheese bacon and sausage but on a side note thank you I’m in love with it

I use recipes from allrecipes frequently. Sometimes I read the review suggestions; sometimes I don’t have time. BUT, the suggestions should not be necessary to make a good recipe! They should be helpful modifications! The oven temp is much too high. After turning the potatoes at 15 minutes, they were starting to burn. Also…no salt? The couple that avoided being charred had such a bitter flavor.
I added in some carrots and everyone loved it. This recipe is a keeper for sure.

I corrected the directions. I only cooked these for 20 min. and turned them after 10 minutes. Otherwise they burn. I love these. I just had to add salt. These are so delish and better for you then fried. I already made them twice in 2 days. I used red potatoes.
Our son loves these! Also use this recipe with sweet potatoes.

I used Yukon Gold potatoes as that's what I had on hand. I used 4 medium sizes and cut them fairly thin. Made the seasoning with exception chili powder These turned out great! Reminded me of Wing Stop fries. Will defintely be making these again. I did follow other and baked at 400.
Very tasty! I adjusted the time and temp as others have stated. Use you judgement with your oven and watch them so they don't burn.

5 stars....Indeed my kids favorite fries....
Perfect temp at 450 for 45 minutes.
Some ovens may be different. My oven cooked them perfectly following this family favorite. 
Thank you for this great recipe.
Excellent recipe! I added a bit of McCormick bacon and chives. it was yummy!

These were amazing! Made them for my picky boyfriend and I and he was shocked they were baked! Definitely going to be making these once a week at least. I also cut my potatoes thinner because I prefer crunchier fries and they turned out well. I took them out 8 minutes earlier since they were very thin.

Very good.
Cooking on a dark pan seems to help brown a bit more.

The flavor is good, however, the temperature and time are very wrong. I made a second batch after I horribly burnt the first batch. I'm sad to say, the second batch was burnt as well. I'm thinking this should be more in the 375-400 degree range for only 30 minutes. Maybe...
This is an easy recipe to make if you are not good at cooking
These are the best fries I’ve ever made they have a nice flavor.

By far the best, baked fries I've come across. I used grapeseed oil instead. It has a higher smoke point than olive oil, and it's a very neutral flavor. I also skipped the chili powder since my daughter isn't too keen on spicy foods. The garlic was just perfect.
I may never fry my fries again! Thank you...

They tasted really good! The only thing is, DONT COOK IT AT 450 degrees!!! It came out pretty burnt, and I only cooked them for 1/4 of the time when my smoke alarm went off, whoops. I recommend 350 degrees, for about 25 minutes, and stir them twice. I also cut the wedges into fries, and added salt and pepper before cooking. Other than that they tasted great! I’ll be sure not to burn them next time... :)
Delicious. They did turn out a little dark at 450 but they were great. Highly recommend. I turned twice while baking.

Perfect! But i think they should only be in the oven 35 minutes, NOT 45... when i did 45 they burned, so i retried with 35 minutes (Flipping every 17 minutes and 30 seconds ) and they turned out perfect!
Yes! This is the one! Great side dish! Better than any froze.
No changes. I will raise the rack or temp to get a crispier outside

This was great, pretty easy, and I had everything on hand. I made a few tweaks based on other reviews... I used minced garlic, and added salt (could have added more). I made a ton... used 7 med russets, and so I used around 1/3 cup oil, and 1 2/3 tsp of each ingredient (other reviews mentioned upping the seasonings and I upped the portions anyhow)...and I mixed everything in a ziplock freezer bag. I followed other suggestions to bake at 400 for 15, turn, and another 15 minutes. I think my wedges were on the thicker side, I could have used a higher temp and longer time to get them crispier on the outside... but they’re great - great base recipe that could be tweaked with adding more garlic and Parmesan or cutting the potatoes thinner to fit whatever you making with it! Will definitely do this again!
turned out great would recommend spraying the cookie sheet ,first
I used normal potatoes and the fries came out too crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Maybe lowering the temperature would help.
Awesome fries! Cooked 35-40 @ 400 as others suggested. Added Cayenne pepper and salt. Yum!
they taste delicious! i used sweet potatoes and normal ones, and the family loves them
Added a little herb mix.
Left out the onion chili powder. 400 deg. for 45 minutes. Very tasty!

Followed the recipe and these wedges turned out beautiful, slightly crunchy, and delicious. The wedges I cut were thick. I feel that if you cut the slices thin like regular French fries they will definitely burn. I also baked these on the lowest rack of the oven.
Will make again very easy

Used 3 smaller potatoes and doubled the spices and oil to accommodate the extra potatoes as well as adjusted the cooking temp and time. They came out crispy but couldn’t taste the spices on them. Had to sprinkle them over the finished product. Will make again though next time maybe coat them in oil then put the seasonings on after they are in the pan. Overall super easy recipe. Perfect for after work. Thanks for the recipe ??
No changes other than temp and time and will make over and over!

I am only gave it 4 because I agree with many others that 400 would be a better temperature and I was at about 30 minutes. I realize that different sizes of potatoes sliced differently cook differently so you really have to take that into account. The spice mix was good. I enjoyed them as did my other half.

Following this recipe almost made my apartment burn down. Temperature is too high and baking time was too long for one potato. 350 degrees and 20 minutes is more pleasing to my smoke detector. Also the seasoning was insufficient.
Very good for lunchtime snacks also!! Really GOOD!! :)
Very good for lunchtime snacks also!! Really GOOD!! :)

I used salt and pepper and cayenne and garlic powder. 
We roasted them on a rack and cut even sized slices to ensure proper cooking. We roasted at 425 Fahrenheit. Keep in mind 450 will most likely burn the fries, depending on how small you cut them . 4 stars because i changed the recipe slightly.
I was winging it and set the oven to 415 F, fries were over done after 45 minutes.
Great and easy recipe!

Good recipe
Will definitely make again
Will put a lot less chili powder this time haha
Pretty good for baked fries, but not as flavorful as I thought they would be.
We’re having these frequently. If you don’t add any salt, they’re a very yummy low-sodium side dish!
The seasoning is tasty. the cook time/temp made my wedges burn to crispy, almost inedible fries. I recommend the cook time be reduced by 10 minutes, at least.
Temp was way to high and too long to cook, baked potatoes stay in for less. Nearly set off the fire alarm with all the smoke that came out of my oven

I went on line to find the temperature to bake my fries at and came across this recipe. I had already planned to spice it up with the suggested spices but added cayenne pepper...LOTS of cayenne pepper (I'm a "heat-aholic!). I used 6 small - medium Russet potatoes and cut them in a 1/4 inch french fry; skins on. I used a generous amount of Canola Oil and put all my spices, oil and potatoes right on the baking sheet and mixed there. I divided the potatoes in 2 batches so they would all lay in a single layer. the first batch came out perfect at 450 degrees and 45 minutes cooking time (large batch approximately 3 small to medium potatoes). Second batch, a smaller batch, I did not add extra oil but added extra spices; cooked them for 40 minutes and they nearly burned. Keep in mind I like my fries on the well-done side and the first batch had many small edges of potato/skin pieces that were crunchy little morsels of goodness.

Lessons learned: Temperature is fine. Less potatoes, less baking time and I think more oil is better.

I hope this helps people who felt the times and temps were wrong. You have to experiment.
I added a sprinkle of dried Rosemary. This the 2nd time I am making this recipe. 100% better than frozen. Thumbs Up!!!

Simple and easy to make! We've made it three times now and like the seasoning for the fries. The first attempt was made as written--bake temp is too high and time to cook is too long. Keep an eye on them to avoid burning, which happens very fast! I'd decrease the amount of oil used, which we did the second time around. These came out much better on convection @ 400F (just hit convection bake and punch in 425; our oven auto-decreases the temp by 25 degrees for convection). They were done at approx. 20-30 min. (I sliced mine thinner instead of having them thick). The last time we made them, I did the above with decreasing olive oil a little and convection baking, but also put them on a rack on the sheet pan and flipped them after 10-15 minutes. Some were still a little soft, but they turned out fine and no complaints. Rating of 3 stars only because we had to play with these a bit to get them right. Otherwise, it is a good recipe! Thanks for sharing the recipe!
great recipe. big hit!
These turned out great. Slightly crispy on the outside and just the right consistency on the inside. I also added a bit of garlic powder and onion powder. Delicious!
I used the exact amount of seasoning for 2 lbs- I think one potato would have been overly seasoned.
If I could rate this less than a star I could. My fries ended up burning and nearly burnt my house down. 45 minutes is far too long to bake fries like that.

I think the heat is too high. I should have used about 350. I had to only keep it in for about 30 minutes because I noticed them really burning. I used way more than a spoon of oil. I covered them completely with oil and half way through, I flipped them and covered them again. They were good, but definitely burned.

These were quite good. However, it took only 25 minutes for the potatoes to fully cooked .
I suspect the time required may vary depending on the type of potato used.
.
Very good, my wedges were a little thick so I cooked a little longer in my convection oven.

These are really bad directions! Preheated oven to 450, coated the fries in oil, put them in the oven, and they were burnt after 22 minutes, not even halfway through.

Since so many of the reviews are saying the directions are too hot for too long, CAN SOMEONE PLEASE JUST UPDATE THE RECIPE? As written, this is an example of the blind leading the blind into a pit. How can all the other reviewers give the recipe a good rating when they know the recipe if followed will burn the food to a crisp?!? All my time preparing this was wasted. (Yeah, Google Home didn’t read me the reviews before it gave me the recipe.)

Here’s a picture of the fries after 22 minutes of cooking. Totally inedible.

I made this baked French Fries potato dish tonight and used Chipotle Chili powder, along with Chipotle flavored olive oil. My wife loved it. I also added minced onions rather than the onion powder. We both ate every fry! I only had small golden potatoes, but they were fine. This will definitely be used again and again. Can't wait to try sweet potatoeswith the recipe. A very easy dish to prepare. 
Mike Hinshaw 
Nomadic Texan
Make sure to turn down the temp and time to avoid burnt fries. I also recommend adding some salt to enhance the flavor. Good recipe though, will make again using these changes.
Going by the directions the fries got a little over cooked, cooking time needed to be reduced to 30 minutes. Flavoring was very good and would not change anything on that part.
Delicious & simple!

Temp was way too high. I cooked for 35 minutes and checked them after flipping halfway through. Good thing cause at 45 minutes they would have been charred black. I would cook next time at 425 and pull to check at 35 minutes. The flavor was really good though!
Mine were done in 25 minutes do keep an eye.
I didn't make any changes to the spices, it wasn't bland and it wasn't too spicy either, just right.

Awesome baked fries! I would cut the cooking time though. 45 minutes has been too long both times I made these. Next time I'll start checking them at 35 minutes so I can remove them from the oven before they overcook.
Turned out great. Best homemade baked fries I've ever had. Thank you!
Awesome just the way it is. No changes needed!
Delicious! Just needs salt!

I don't understand why, but my oven started smoking and then flames appeared. Then I read online that you should never use olive oil to cook fries on high heat because the oil's burn point is very low. Did anyone else have this problem? We ended up having to turn off the oven, open all the doors, and switch everything over to the frying pan. :/ I'll be using ghee next time.

Did exactly what the recipe said and the fries burned. I checked some of the reviews afterward and many people mentioned that you shouldn't follow the recipe's directions because if you do the fries will burn. Waste of potatoes.
This was great! The only thing I changed was I set the heat at 390 and only had them in for 30 minutes! Turned out perfect!
This recipe gave me burnt fries! Wish I first had read the person who suggested lowering the temperature to 400. Completely burnt!!
Delicious!
it wasn't what we expected. rather bland and lacked flavor, crispness and salt.
Thank you for the tip around temperature and time. 200C for 30m. 15m flip. Turned out perfect.
Bake at 400 for 22 minutes, turn potatoes over and bake another 22. Everyone loved it including the kids!
Bake at 400 for 22 minutes, turn potatoes over and bake another 22. Everyone loved it including the kids!
These are my kids favourite fries. So delicious!

I'm bad at measuring, so I just poured approximate of the ingredients over it (make sure you don't over-do the olive oil if using this method). I used the exact time and temp recommended and they came out perfectly! If you're looking for crunchier, obviously just cut your fries thinner and watch them like a hawk. I can't stop making them now! I put them on a sprayed aluminum lined baking sheet and shook them gently half-way through. No trouble getting them off the pan. Made some sriracha aioli to dip in - TASTY.
The flavour was great, but I had to adjust the cook temp + time as per the comments. Baked at 400 for around 35 minutes, flipping every 15 minutes. They turned out fantastic.

I didn't read the recommendation to lower the temp a bit, but really didn't see an issue. They were crispy, but I like fries that way. I didn't have onion powder or paprika, but I did add salt, pepper and a little cayenne pepper for some kick. Good solid side dish and something I will do again, but not anything really special.
These were very easy and had a great taste. I used smaller potatoes (3) and they came out fine, however, they only took 20 to 25 minutes . Quick, easy side dish.
I cooked for 30 minutes and they were burned to a crisp. Reduce temp tp 400 for 25 minutes was just right.
Mine didn’t turn out so well. The egg white stuck to the foil and the fries didn’t turn golden brown. I would not make these again. Kids disliked them too.
I made them in smaller wedges and only cooked them for 25 minutes at 425° ... They both were a little well done but tasty!
bad
Love these! We added salt and turned them once during cooking! Great with burgers!

Sure enough, like the comments said, following this original recipe burned my fries. I later put them on at 400 degrees F, with only about 30 minutes, not even, and I did flip them. 

I was originally excited about this recipe because of all the many ratings being positive, but I see that's only because they modified theirs. I found these fries to have very little seasoning and most of them ended up burnt. Also, very little flavor, add some salt!

Since I made a big batch, I was left with some that were eatable, but not plain, so we made them into nacho fries, piled with other tasty things. 

Good luck!

delish!!!! I used fajita seasoning instead of chili powder but otherwise followed the recipe. Make sure to turn them halfway through the cooking time. Temp and time was perfection!! Golden brown and fabulous!!!

These fries turned out pretty good. I added salt and ground black pepper. I baked them at 425 degrees for approximately 40 minutes. These are a good option if you want to avoid frying and don’t care for frozen varieties. However, they take a little longer to make.
Was great I made it for a family dinner night and everybody loved them! I loved making it!!!
Great! My boys loved it! By mistake i put smoked paprika ...but still was great! Definitely recommend!!
My fries were done in 35 minutes. I took them to a dinner and got great reviews. To make them young kid-friendly, pull back on or eliminate the chili powder.
Easy to make, comes out like they were fried, but not oily/greasy. I don't have a deep fryer so this recipe is a keeper for me.
Best baked fries I've ever made! kids loved them too

I made these tonight and they were AMAZING! I too lowered the temperature to 400 and baked them for 35-40 minutes , turning them at the 20 minute mark. I did not have chili powder, but I had the next best thing .......SIRACHA !!!!!! I drizzled a lot on top and mixed them up before baking , for some reason it made them even taste cheesy but I wasn’t complaining , everyone loved them even my dad who is super picky about spicy things !!
I'm sure this recipe is good WITH THE RIGHT TEMPS AND TIME. Burnt my fries. Adjust your times please.
Would have been a 4* review if it were a recipe for charcoal. How is this 5* if the default temperatures are completely off?
My husband loves these fries. I cut them thin, and bake them at 400 for 30 minutes turning halfway through the cooking time. They are crisp on the outside & soft on the inside.
